sentence.Network_en: He nodded with a peculiarly male satisfaction at her capitulation.
sentence.Network_cn: 对她的屈服,他以一种男人特有的满足感点了点头.

sentence.Network_en: The invading army had massacred many of the garrison after capitulation.
sentence.Network_cn: 侵略军在守军投降后仍将多人屠杀了.

sentence.Network_en: Lord Luce's capitulation to pressure from the Duke of Edinburgh has stored up huge problems for the future.
sentence.Network_cn: 卢斯勋爵迫于爱丁堡公爵的压力作了让步，为日后埋下了巨大隐患。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 18个月前，劳伦斯·芬克曾“预言”：除非“投降式抛售”(capitulation)出现，否则市场还远远没有见底。　　6个月前，金融危机迅速席卷全球。
CAP词根 ... capituer v 投降 capitulation n 投降条约降书 décapiter v 杀头.
投降用英文怎么说．_百度知道 ... 投降 surrender 投降书 capitulation 投降主义者的 capitulationist.
There is no specified form for capitulation ., 投降协议并无固定形式.

list.abs: The planters ' ladies were the last capitulate ., 庄园主的夫人们是最后被征服的.
"capit... ... bear capitulation 熊市投降; collective capitulation 集体投降; military capitulation 军事投降协定; 军事投降.
Smith capitulated to John ' s demand ., 史密斯屈从于约翰的要求.
their forces capitulated five hours after the Allied bombardment of the city began .同盟军开始轰炸这个城市五个小时后，他们的部队投降了。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from late Latin capitulatio(n-), from the verb capitulare (see capitulate)

entry.def: If you capitulate, you stop resisting and do what someone else wants you to do.

example.ex: The club eventually capitulated and now grants equal rights to women...
example.tran: 那家俱乐部最终还是让了步,现在赋予女性以平等权利。

example.ex: In less than two hours Cohen capitulated to virtually every demand.
example.tran: 还不到两个小时,科恩就屈服了,接受了几乎一切要求。

means.word_mean: 1. a summary that enumerates the main parts of a topic
2. the act of surrendering (under agreed conditions);

sentences.sentence: "they were protected until the capitulation of the fort"
